reviews.sentence: Exceeded Expectations. it is the New Year and I decided to take an impromptu trip to Chattanooga. I have never been to the city and it did not disappoint. After a long day of shopping I decided to stay the night. I could not decide on a hotel but was recommended by one of the sales associates at a shop to try this hotel. I am glad I did. I have stayed at a Doubletree only once and I must admit it was not memorable. However I will remember this one. The front desk clerk Jake was phenomenal. Check in was a breeze. He gave me tips on places to go and things to do. He even threw in a couple discounts coupons to take to a nearby bar restaurant. Because I am also a Hilton Rewards member I was able to get the room at a discounted rate. I was happy to see they designated members with their own floors. Nice touch. The room had modern decor with striking bold color and dark wood. The room was very clean cozy and more than enough space for just myself. The breakfast was great. I am not the most picky eater however I am picky about presentation and taste of food. Again I was impressed. The chef made a mouth watering omelet and the hot and cold bar was well stocked. The servers were very nice and informative as well. I received even more information about things to do on my next visit. And yes. I will be visiting again. As much as I love to switch hotels for different experiences I will try this one again. It does not hurt that I learned they also have renovations coming up soon. As nice as the hotel is now I can hardly wait to see this establishment after.

Double Tree. I happened to stay here because of an airline snafu. Long story but the property is great and I had a king suite due to last minute reservation. The only negative I have is I asked the front desk to describe prices for the restaurant there and she could not claiming lack of knowledge. Really and you work the front desk. You never assist someone with this question. Oh well. You know what made up for this is how nice the room cleaning service ladies were. So friendly and pleasant. Put them at the front desk. Otherwise a great property at a great location downtown.

Business pleasure. Excellent service and nice lobby but the rooms need an update. Stylish furnishings but shabby with chipped veneer on the wood furniture and marks on the walls. Just did not feel clean and new for the price even in a suite. On an earlier trip we stayed at the Hampton across the street which was newer. However the doubletree was very quiet a great breakfast and a service oriented staff.

Not worth the price. 1No Continental breakfast. 2Unles your an honors member you will be given 2nd class room. 3Price is too high for Chattanooga Tennessee. 4. The rooms were average at best 5. We did nt feel like we got the bang for our buck.

Excellent. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had a pleasant stay. The breakfast was delicious and reasonably priced. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We will return in the future. This is a great place for a family function. Great location.

Great location in Downtown Chattanooga. This is my favorite hotel to stay in downtown Chattanooga. It is a great location and within walking distance to many bars restaurants and attractions Aquarium IMAX ATT Field Home of the Chattanooga Lookouts Walnut Street Bridge and many other attractions. The rooms are always clean and the beds are best. Check. In staff has always been very helpful as is Valet.

Great property with excellent service. I stayed at the Doubletree in Chattanooga for business meeting in mid May. It is excellent property right in heart of downtown. I was upgrade to suite which was great. There is good bar and food in hotel. The hotel is very clean and has great service. The front desk attendees were very helpful with providing recommendations on restaurants and things to do. The hotel is close to downtown entertainment areas and things to do. Excellent hotel and highly recommended.

Weekend getaway. My wife stayed the weekend for a little Chattanooga vacation. We have stayed in Chattanooga previously but not at this property. If you are coming to Chattanooga for the usual tourist attractions the Aquarium the Lookouts or the Riverwalk then you could not find a better place. All of these and the other downtown attractions are within walking distance. We arrived before check in time but our room was ready and we checked right in. The room while not spacious was comfortable clean and cool. There were the usual amenities on the property the ones we used were the pool and the H2O bar. The pool was probably designed more adults to lounge in than for actual swimming. There is a ledge to sit on ringing the pool several comfortable chairs in the pool area the pool looks larger in the photo than it actually is. Everyone we encountered were very polite pleasant and helpful. We are usually pretty easy to accommodate and no real need for any special requests.

Friendly clean good amenities for the price. Overall good hotel with good amenities for the price. Room is usually clean and quiet other than rooms with an adjoining door. Great location for downtown activities good restaurant and bar. Easy parking friendly staff.

Great weekend stay. Checked in by Chris at the front desk and he was quite friendly and helpful. Room was clean and well stocked. Breakfast at the Eleven restaurant was excellent and plentiful. Hotel and restaurant staff did a good job making our weekend stay very pleasant.

Location friendliness over functionality and price. Staff very friendly except for the valets. Hotel location very good to everything. Price is a joke for room size as the room is the smallest I have ever stayed in. Ridiculous to pay for parking on hotel property. Elevators 2 extremely slow as they are used by the housekeeping staff. It was faster to walk the 8 floors of stairs than to wait for the elevator. No water fountain in hotel.
Staff was friendly place is nice however my TV did not work and I found a dead mosquito under my pillow. Very disappointed after paying so much for my room expected better from a Double Tree.

Could be a solid property with a decent location just a quick walk from Market St and the aquarium area but service simply was not up to brand standards. Rooms not ready until well after check in time front desk constantly understaffed and the rooms themselves are a bit worn and incredibly noisy. Not sure if there is just no service elevator but dining staff were constantly going up and down the guest elevators. that is generally fine except they were so impatient that they kept hitting the close door button on every floor often shutting the doors in the face of guests attempting to get on. what is worse most of the staff do not seem to think any of this is a problem and did not even offer an apology let alone an attempt at service recovery. Two bright spots are the cheerful woman working in the cafe and the valet crew. But we will not be returning here the next time we are in Chattanooga.

This place is wonderful they have valet parking everything at your fingertips service goes above and beyond what you would expect. The only thing I did not like was the price of room service that was way to high other then that I would recommend this place to you.

Great location disappointing room. Room was dirty with leftover food not cleaned up grout missing from the shower floor tiles subsequently a lot of dirt and grime in between the tiles and not cleaned properly. Toilet had not been cleaned fully. Shower pressure was really low and the shower itself was very small. The room was tight and difficult to move around. Nowhere to really open up a suitcase. In house food options were expensive. Elevators felt dirty and clumsy. Would not stay there again. Only redeeming factor was a helpful and friendly staff at the desk. This was our anniversary weekend to hang out and enjoy Chattanooga but the hotel left a bad taste. Thankfully we enjoyed our time outside the hotel. Location. Downtown area is a little sparse for things to do unles you want to eat and drink. Fun riverboat cruise and a few things to see in walking distance A lot. Cleanliness for one. Hotel needs some updates especially the bathroom and the elevators.

I can not even begin to say enough great things. We checked in last night after having to checkout of another nearby hotel for being unclean and after telling the front desk that they wasted no time into getting us into a room. Not only did they feel like they had to make up for the other hotel who was in no way associated with the Hilton or any sister properties. but they also went out of their way to take care of us. From Cedric at valet parking who saw I was there by myself with 2 kids and not only entertained them while I checked in but then carried all of our stuff to our room and unloaded it to Brandon who brought a pack n play up to the room came in and set it up for us to housekeeping who made sure we did not go without anything we needed. we have definitely found the hotel well be staying at every time we visit Chattanooga. Thanks again for everything.

Wow. What a staff this place has. My wife and I enjoyed a recent trip to Chattanooga to rest recharge. We stayed for two nights. We arrived to an unusually pleasant valet parking staff. Normally once valet parking attendants know that they are not using their service they have nothing to do with you. But not here while I was getting an extra key they brought the luggage carts over to the car and made sure my wife was ok while she unloaded the luggage. The front desk staff was amazing. We needed some extra linens and the young man ran to the laundry room and handed me towels fresh out of the dryer. As we were leaving we bumped into one of the maintenance guys. He asked if we enjoyed our stay. I really do not know what they put in the water of the staff break room but they need to keep doing it. We will definitely be back.

Pleasant. I liked the cleanliness of the room. I was unhappy with the staff at check in the noise all day in the room the fact that I got charged for parking when I did n’t even park here and the price for what was included. I probably wo n’t ever splurge for a Hilton hotel again. I think I would ’ve gotten better service at other hotels in the area.

Do n’t stay during renovation. It was horrible. They are remodeling and they were scraping paint by our window non stop for 3 hours. I could n’t even hear the tv it was so loud. We were on the 11th floor.

The place sux. Only one elevator works. You have to walk up the stairs or sometimes wait 30 minutes. I could not get any rest as there was a construction worker beating and banging right outside my window. We ate breakfast one morning. The food was cold. How can you melt frozen butter on a cold biscuit. Daniel Self.
